org.jcvi.jillion.core.io

Class FileUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.core.io.FileUtil

  • public final class FileUtil
extends Object
    FileUtil is a Utility class containing common static methods to work with File objects.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • createRelavitePathFrom

        public static String createRelavitePathFrom(File root,
                                            File otherFile)
                                     throws IOException
        Creates a String of the relative path from the given root to the other given file.
        Parameters:
        root - the File to start from.
        otherFile - the File to get to.
        Returns:
        a String of containing the relative file path required to traverse the file system to get from one file to the other.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem finding the location of either file on the file system.

      • createRelavitePathFrom

        public static String createRelavitePathFrom(File root,
                                            File otherFile,
                                            char pathSeparator)
                                     throws IOException
        Creates a String of the relative path from the given root to the other given file.
        Parameters:
        root - the File to start from.
        otherFile - the File to get to.
        pathSeparator - the path separator for this File system.
        Returns:
        a String of containing the relative file path required to traverse the file system to get from one file to the other.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem finding the location of either file on the file system.

      • getExtension

        public static String getExtension(File file)
        Get the extension part of a file. For example, if the file points to a file named "Readme.txt" then this method will return "txt".
        Parameters:
        file - the file to get the extension for. If this value is null, then null will be returned.
        Returns:
        the String of the extension, or null if the file is null, or the empty string "" if there is no extension.

      • getExtension

        public static String getExtension(String filepath)
        Get the extension part of a filepath. For example, if the given filepath is to a file named "Readme.txt" or "/path/to/Readme.txt" then this method will return "txt".
        Parameters:
        filepath - the filepath to get the extension for. If this value is null, then null will be returned.
        Returns:
        the String of the extension, or null if filepath is null, or the empty string "" if there is no extension.

      • getBaseName

        public static String getBaseName(File file)
        Get the base portion of the file name from the given File. For example, if the given File points to a file named "Readme.txt" or "/path/to/Readme.txt" then this method will return "Readme".
        Parameters:
        file - the File to get the base name for. If this value is null, then null will be returned.
        Returns:
        the String of the base name, or null if File is null, or the empty string "" if there is no basepath.

      • getBaseName

        public static String getBaseName(String filename)
        Get the base portion of the file name from the given filepath. For example, if the given filepath is to a file named "Readme.txt" or "/path/to/Readme.txt" then this method will return "Readme".
        Parameters:
        filename - the filepath to get the base name for. If this value is null, then null will be returned.
        Returns:
        the String of the base name, or null if filepath is null, or the empty string "" if there is no basepath.
